qna.question: A cluster has 3 instances launched from 3 subnets in different availability zones. A service is created with desired number of tasks as 3. How does the service scheduler place the tasks on the instances by default?
correctAnswers: From the list of eligible instances, the ECS Scheduler uses binpack(memory) to determine the instance on which the task has to be placed.
incorrectAnswers: From the list of eligible instances, the ECS Scheduler uses the spread(availability-zone), and spread(instance-id) to determine the instance on which the task has to be placed.
From the list of eligible instances, the ECS Scheduler uses distinctInstance to determine the instance on which the task has to be placed.
From the list of eligible instances, the ECS Scheduler uses the spread(availability-zone) and binpack(memory) to determine the instance on which the task has to be placed.

qna.question: I am launching tasks within a service using the awsvpc network mode, the instance type being used is c5n.xlarge awsvpctrunking is enabled on this account. What is the maximum number of tasks that I can run on this instance?
In order to check the requests made using the credentialsProvider when the containers are using the task role which log file can you check? Where can you find this log file?
incorrectAnswers: /var/log/ecs/audit.log.YYYY-MM-DD-HH, on the container running the application

responses.correct: And knowing is half the battle!
responses.incorrect: And knowing is half the battle!
